idea_text:
The ability to post a consistent email signature that is customized to title and name for each account. 
This would save time and add brand equity.

comments.text: Request full email signature with graphics for iPhone
Hi,Would it be possible to have the Signature set in Outlook online automatically added to every email in mobile app?The way its done with gmail.
bv
nn
Please build this in to EAC.

Hello, I have been trying to find a work around to have the signature appear under under each employee on 44 different accounts as a default and it pull in their %%name%% %%phone%% %%email%% automatically into the signature... unfortunately after setting up all of the accounts, importing the mail onto the cloud server the only solution Microsoft has for this is if the solution is deployed on a local server.  This is really frustrating. Not only that confusing. Not having this solution affects smaller clients significantly less because they can simply just attach manually add the signature to their 4/5 devices or accounts and be done with it. My clients organization has 45 accounts each user with a desktop/laptop/phone, so microsoft is causing more work for their bigger spending clients... Makes zero sense. My client is spending over 600$ per month and we have to do some crazy disclaimer work around, not only that but are paying my time to come up with these crazy solutions. Really silly on something so basic as a global signature.Office 365 do yourself a favour and figure it out before my client decides to pull the trigger and cancel his account.

The disclaimer approach is poor at best.  The end user composing the email never gets to set unless they receive a reply, it is always appended to the end of the entire message thread, not the most recent message.  Why not add a place in exchange to store the signature block (both an HTML version and a plain text version).  Add the appropriate controls so the admin can either allow the end user to do their own thing, OR, flip the switch (either on the mailbox itself, or the entire domain) and the end user can no longer update the signature, but it is ALWAYS sent, and appears in the proper place.  Switches envisioned:-UserCanEdit (true or false)
-HTMLSignature ",,,,,," (the html....)
-TextSignature "....." (the textual version, complete with line breaks)
-ReplyUseSignature (true or false - inserts the appropriate signature for replies to messages, or not)
-ForwardUseSignature (true or false - inserts the appropriate signature for forwarding of messages, or not)
-ShowSignatureInEditor (true or false - places a copy of the configured signature into the message at the appropriate location, and allows the end user to manipulate that copy).
-SignatureOnMobile (true or false - inserts the signature when emailing on a mobile/smart device)
-SignatureOnOutlookClient (true or false - overides what is configured in the Microsoft Outlook Desktop application for signatures)
-

Agree with all comments.Signature fields need conditional logic.
E.g. {{IF%%PhoneNumber%%}}Phone: %% PhoneNumber%%{{ELSE}}Call Reception{{ENDIF}}Configurable insertion point (below current reply and option to avoid repeat insertion).Option to force html format for mail (i.e. convert emails sent in plaintext from iPhone/iPad) when inserting the signature.Don't expect to require/pay a third party to provide basic signature functionality. Should be built into the default offering.

Just to add to this - the rule to manage email signatures has three issues for us:Cannot hide fields that are blank in Active Directory (EG: if you put a "Phone: %%PhoneNumber%%" field in, it will display whether the mailbox has a phone number specified or not)Cannot specify to prevent the disclaimer going on every email (ie: email is sent to external party, disclaimer is added. This stacks up on every reply sent out of the business and must cause the death of so many trees when these emails get printed!)Cannot support images (seems a basic requirement not being met)
you can do and make it easy your self... but not sure if you ever have looked into this
DHAdmin has the solution.... go buy up the top company already supplying this feature.
This Feature is alarming to think they did not figure out untill now, this is just like having a tel.nr. Not the greatest results compared to Greater happenings. I think reality confuses us.

You can create a rule to apply a common sig line in the tenant, but the problem is it is applied every time an email is sent. If the user has replies back and forth on the same message, it keeps stacking up the signatures at the bottom of the message. There needs to be a simple check to see if the signature exists, them don't apply it again. A solution for this is offered by CodeTwo, but would prefer it be done automatically in out O365 tenant.

Centralised signature management is a must these days and really hope Microsoft roll out something soon. 
Outlook signature management is and has always been poor, so a management solution would be the perfect addition for 365 for business. 
There are plenty of websites out there peddling such a web service that outbound email to be 'stamped' with a signature rather than having to manually apply a signature at the client/device level.

Azure AD needs a button instantly and easily unlock a user account which has been locked from too many missed attempts.It is extremely awkward helping people who have locked themselves out via the web mail portal or in one instance a user changed their login password when requested, but mis-entered their password in Outlook and locked themselves out through multiple retries. Is this not possible yet?

In case the O365 team is still unclear - This request applies in a hybird environment, where on-prem AD accounts are synced with AzureAD, and password write-back is enabled.  
When a user logging into a computer or otherwise authenticating against on-prem AD enters the wrong password multiple times, their AD account becomes 'locked out' for a period of time, preventing them from logging in even with the correct password.  Users commonly call the helpdesk to have their account unlocked, but do not need or want their password to be reset.  
In a hybrid environment, the Office 365 Admin mobile app should allow an admin to unlock a user account without resetting the password.  To my knowledge there is no way currently to unlock an on-prem AD account from Office 365.  However, the feature does exist as part of AzureAD self-service password reset.  An end user can access the SSPR site, verify their identity, and unlock their on-prem AD account without having to reset their password.

3rd party app developers are WAY ahead of Microsoft on getting Outlook Tasks on mobile devices.  I've used the following setup for over two years.  It uses Google Tasks as an Outlook Task server.
1. If you don't have one already, get a Gmail account (free).
2. Install the GogTasks addon ($9) to Outlook desktop.
3. Get the gTasks app ($6) for your mobile device.GogTask syncs your Outlook Tasks with your Google Tasks, gTasks is your mobile Outlook task manager via Google.  Once you get everything configured it's flawless.  The only shortcoming is that it doesn't support all of the Outlook Task fields (like Priority and Start Date).  It's a separate app on your mobile device but it beats waiting around for "we really don't care what our customers want" Microsoft to get their act together on Outlook Mobile.

header: REST API for Mobile Device Management (Block/Deny/Allow)
idea_text: We currently quarantine devices that are using native mail clients on iOS, Android and Windows Phone.  The quarantine email the user receives instructs them to visit a custom web application only available within our corporate network to then approve their device.  This is in place to provide a pseudo multi-factor experience since the native mobile applications do not support MFA.When a user "approves" their device, the custom web application uses Exchange PowerShell Remoting to "Allow" the device for the user.  We have been using this approach on premise for quite a few years now and it has been working flawlessly.Now that we are moving to Exchange Online, we have to take care to tightly manage the remote PowerShell connections to Exchange Online because of the connection throttling that Exchange Online has in place to protect the service.It would be great if there was a REST API available to perform these sort of management operations for mobile devices.  Getting PowerShell to work in the context of a web application on the server side has a lot of challenges that need to be overcome.  Not to mention, the process to build up a remote connection to Exchange Online takes 20+ seconds to build up and tear down.  REST API would be a much lighter weight and modern solution to manage things in Exchange Online than PowerShell.We are also aware that the Outlook App for iOS and Android support MFA.  However, until the Outlook App is closer in feature parity to the native application, we are not able to move to the application.  Specifically, contact sync, calendar shortcomings and lack of notes/task sync is what is keeping us from fully adopting the Outlook for iOS and Android app at this point in time.

header: Add PIN security to keep others from accessing my app

comments.text:
There are a few security issues with App Passwords while using MFA. The security around App Passwords needs to be strengthened. 
First, App Passwords of all Alpha lower case is not as secure as the current passwords policies our users are using. By enabling MFA, our users are complaining about the strength of the App Password. 
Second, App Passwords that can be re-used are lessening the password security of user accounts. This allows users to copy/paste or write down the password to be used again and again. 
Suggestions. 
- Increase the complexity of the App Password (upper case, lower Case, special character, and 16+ characters long) 
- Change the App Password to be usable for only one app on one device. This way if it is hacked, then it is not usable by anyone.

idea_text: I want to be able to set a users mail delivery route from the app so I can forward a users email on the go.

I need to be able to restrict users so that they can only forward their e-mail to addresses inside of our organization.  There are two different parameters available, forwardingaddress(internal) and forwardingsmtpaddress(external), but both have to be added in order for the forwarding option to become available in the portal for the user.

"Mailbox Forwarding" is a MUST-have for the app AND it needs to be MUCH easier to access in the portal itself.   It should be available at the user level of the user has an Office 365 mailbox.  In the app, it's ESPECIALLY important as the Safari, LastPass, and IE/Bing browsers on iPhone at least will not let you click the "Save" button on the Exchange Admin section of the Office 365 Portal when accessing from a mobile device.  Since the most common time we get forwarding requests for our clients is terminations... It's critical that wet be able to forward a mailbox from our mobile devices.

comments.text:
In the excitement of getting stuck into life in a new country and tackling all the challenges that presents, it's easy for pensions to slip down the list of things to keep track of. This is especially true if you don't plan to stay in Sweden long-term. But don't let it fall off the radar; follow The Local's guide to manage and maximize your Swedish pension, even if you don't intend to stay here permanently.Image
If you're working and paying tax in Sweden, you're probably entitled to a pension. Here's what you need to know. Photo: Simon Paulin/imagebank.sweden.se
This article is available to Members of The Local. Read more about membership here.The Swedish pension is part of the country's social insurance system, and it can seem like a confusing beast at times. The good news is that if you're living and working here, you'll almost certainly be earning towards a pension, and you'll be able to get that money even if you move elsewhere before retirement.Exactly how much money goes into your pension pot depends on many factors, including your salary, length of time working in Sweden, your company's policy, and your own personal decisions (especially if you're self-employed). Those who spend only a few years working in Sweden will earn a much smaller pension than people who work here for their whole lives, but that money could come in very useful once you retire, so it's important to know what you'll be entitled to.The easiest way to understand how the Swedish pension works is breaking it down into three parts. There are three different sources for the Swedish pension: the state, your employer, and yourself.If you've worked and paid tax in Sweden, you should be entitled to a Swedish pension. Photo: Simon Paulin/imagebank.sweden.seFirst, there's the state pension (allm√§n pension), which comes from money paid in tax, and makes up the biggest part of most people's total pensions. It falls under the remit of the Pensionsmyndigheten or the Swedish Pensions Agency, a government authority dedicated to, you guessed it, pensions.Absolutely everyone who has worked and paid tax in Sweden is entitled to this pension, and it's split into two parts: an income pension and a premium pension.The income pension (inkomstpension) makes up the bulk of this. Each year, 16 percent of your income is paid into this pension. In this context, 'income' includes wages as well as all other taxable benefits such as paid sickness or parental leave, and unemployment benefits.It's the employer who pays this, as part of the fees associated with employment, so you won't see it deducted from your salary and there's nothing that you as an employee need to do. The higher your salary, the higher the income pension will be, although once you reach the upper limit on pensionable income, your state pension won't increase any further. This upper ceiling was 41,359 kronor per month for the income year 2017, though this amount is regularly adjusted.Keep track of your Swedish pension to be prepared for retirement. Photo: Henrik Montgomery/TTOn top of the income pension, a further 2.5 percent of your income goes into investment funds (the premium pension or 'premiepension'). Again, this is paid by the employer, but if you want to, you can choose which funds your money goes into. If you do not make a choice, your money will be invested in AP7 S√•fa, the Seventh AP Fund (National Generation Management Option) which is the default option.If you do want to move your funds, this can be done as often as you want, for free, by logging into the Swedish Pensions Agency's website using BankID. You can have up to five funds at the same time, and there is a list

comments.text: You cannot add, delete or edit contacts.  Also, "notes" are either incomplete or missing altogether in many contacts but are in the desktop application and in OWA.

I can't stress too much how much I want this feature.  I'm trying out the Outlook app as part of experimenting with O365's built in MDM for our company.  I've been using Touchdown for many years and it supports this function. I think most built in native email clients have it as well.At a minimum being able to set it to a sync interval for something other than PUSH would be a positive step.  
Scenario 1: I'm at work, in front of my computer.  I don't need my phone buzzing every time I get an email.  I have Outlook open on my computer. It just adds to the stress level by over-notification.  Because I'm occasionally away from my desk, I don't want turn the notifications off totally.  I had Touchdown set to sync every 2 hours.  That would give me the ability to reasonably stay ahead of any notification spam on my phone.
Scenario 2: On Vacation where I still want to be 'somewhat' in touch.  I could turn the polling frequency down to 4 hours.
Scenario 3: On vacation, and I don't want to be bothered unless I have the time. I could then turn the polling to manual.  
Scenario 4: I am at work, away from my computer for a consistent period of time. Then I could turn it on PUSH.Stress relieved... I'm not so much looking for battery preservation, just sanity preservation.

header: We need to enforce PIN og passcode to this app via Intune application policies.
idea_text: There is a major security risk - as the O365 admin app does not prompt for authentication, nor does it allow you to apply a application PIN - which is usually applied via MAM policy settings.

comments.text:
App Password security breach while using MFA. This is specific to iPhone users iOS App. 
Customer has > 500 users affected. Not huge, and the customer is Not a dedicated account, but still important to listen to‚Ä¶There are a few security issues with App Passwords while using MFA. The security around App Passwords needs to be strengthened. 
First, App Passwords of all Alpha lower case is not as secure as the current passwords policies our users are using. By enabling MFA, our users are complaining about the strength of the App Password. 
Second, App Passwords that can be re-used are lessening the password security of user accounts. This allows users to copy/paste or write down the password to be used again and again. 
Suggestions. 
- Increase the complexity of the App Password (upper case, lower Case, special character, and 16+ characters long) 
- Change the App Password to be usable for only one app on one device. This way if it is hacked, then it is not usable by anyone.

Here is a question from a customer, they are migrating to Office 365 and had the following concerns about Auto Attendant feature in EXO Unified messaging component:At Northwestern, Mutual we are trying to evaluate if Exchange UM AA is capable enough to replace our 3rd party speech attendant solution ‚ÄòNuance‚Äô and below are the findings based on our research.
We want to get a Microsoft opinion if there is something missing here or if there are new features upcoming or some offering in O365 that can meet the replacement that we are looking for.Nuance Capabilities: -
ÔÇß	Allows callers to speak the name of a person and be transferred to that person‚Äôs extension.
ÔÇß	Allows callers to speak the name of specific departments and be transferred to an associated extension.
ÔÇß	Allows callers to speak the name of a conference room and be transferred to the phone extension in that room.
ÔÇß	Is set up to recognize multiple ways department and conference room names are spoken.
ÔÇß	Handles calls to ‚ÄúOperator‚Äù after business hours.  
ÔÇß	Has different greetings for normal business day hours and afterhours.  These hours are defined in the system and changeover happens automatically.
ÔÇß	Has pre-recorded greetings that can be swapped in for special circumstances (holiday, inclement weather
ÔÇß	Has a schedule for holiday dates.
ÔÇß	‚ÄúPerson‚Äù information is fed into Nuance menus via feed from Avotus 
ÔÇß	Department/conference room information is fed into Nuance via a created .csv file.
ÔÇß	Names are professionally recorded and FTP‚Äôd into the system by the vendor.
ÔÇß	Specific pronunciations for names can be requested to be recorded by the vendor.
ÔÇß	Aliases can be defined for names (for example ‚ÄúBob‚Äù or ‚ÄúRob‚Äù for ‚ÄúRobert‚Äù) and Nuance will answer to any of them.
ÔÇß	Can monitor calls in real-time.
ÔÇß	Reports from vendor are provided automatically via e-mail.  
ÔÇß	Weekly reports show Call Details, Port Occupancy and Request per Navigation results per site.  
ÔÇß	Monthly Directory Assist reports show errors that occurred in call handling and provide recommendations for improving system performance.  
ÔÇß	Monthly SpeechCare reports provide information on services provided by the vendor (backup status, server info, reports delivered, names recorded, days left on support contract, etc.).
ÔÇß	Can be set up for supervised or blind transfers.UM Auto-Attendant comparison: -Can‚Äôt do with AA
ÔÇß	Can‚Äôt call conference room by name (Display Name attribute on Room phones are not populated)
ÔÇß	Department calling will be limited to 9 (Each AA can only have 9 keymap entry and 0 is reserved for operator) ‚Äì Example "Sales, 77899","Service, 78990".
ÔÇß	Can't recognize multiple ways department and conference room names are spoken
ÔÇß	Cannot feed different patterns for a name via input file
ÔÇß	Can‚Äôt feed person info and names via CSV input files
ÔÇß	The called destination must be UM enabled 
ÔÇß	Can't feed professionally recorded names
ÔÇß	No custom aliases
ÔÇß	No Reporting
ÔÇß	No Real-time monitoring (we can probably pull call counts and active calls via perfmon counters)Can do with AA
ÔÇß	Name based dialing (speak or dial)
ÔÇß	Custom greetings for Business & Non-business hours
ÔÇß	Custom prompt menu for Business & Non-business hours
ÔÇß	Information Greeting can be added (this should cover for the holiday/inclement weather)
ÔÇß	Person information is read from Active directory
ÔÇß	Can dial person‚Äôs extension (7 digits)
ÔÇß	DTMF fallback Attendant
ÔÇß	Holiday Schedule 
ÔÇß	Assign default operatorPlease let us know your opinion or redirect to whoever can best assist us.
Thanks for your help!

In the excitement of getting stuck into life in a new country and tackling all the challenges that presents, it's easy for pensions to slip down the list of things to keep track of. This is especially true if you don't plan to stay in Sweden long-term. But don't let it fall off the radar; follow The Local's guide to manage and maximize your Swedish pension, even if you don't intend to stay here permanently.Image
If you're working and paying tax in Sweden, you're probably entitled to a pension. Here's what you need to know. Photo: Simon Paulin/imagebank.sweden.se
This article is available to Members of The Local. Read more about membership here.The Swedish pension is part of the country's social insurance system, and it can seem like a confusing beast at times. The good news is that if you're living and working here, you'll almost certainly be earning towards a pension, and you'll be able to get that money even if you move elsewhere before retirement.Exactly how much money goes into your pension pot depends on many factors, including your salary, length of time working in Sweden, your company's policy, and your own personal decisions (especially if you're self-employed). Those who spend only a few years working in Sweden will earn a much smaller pension than people who work here for their whole lives, but that money could come in very useful once you retire, so it's important to know what you'll be entitled to.The easiest way to understand how the Swedish pension works is breaking it down into three parts. There are three different sources for the Swedish pension: the state, your employer, and yourself.

header: How To Fix‚Äù Can‚Äôt Sign Into AOL Mail‚Äù? AOL Mail Login Problem
idea_text:
Solution:- 
I‚Äôm having trouble signing in to my account
Can't access AOL Mail? Do you get one of these alerts when you try to sign in?
  a) "We detected unusual activity," or
  b) "Your Username or Password is incorrect"?
If so, then first off, we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. To protect your account and get back in, you'll need to reset your password.
Go to aol.com to get it done. Typically this is quick and easy. But if you're unable to change your password
If you're not seeing either of the alerts above when you attempt to sign in, it might be an issue with your browser. Here are two things to try.
Set your browser's security setting to default
1. First, determine the browser version you're using.
2. Once you‚Äôve identified your browser version, read our help article Reset Browser Security Settings to Default Level to learn how to set your browser security settings.
3. Try signing in again.
Clear your browser‚Äôs cookies, cache, history and footprints
1. Clear your browser's cookies, cache, history and footprints to clean your computer's disk space. Visit our help article Clear cookies, cache, history and footprints in your browser to learn how.
2. Try signing in again.
You barely have time to clean out your closet, so why bother clearing cookies, cache, history and footprints in your browser? A few reasons to consider tidying up:
‚Ä¢ Websites store temporary files and cookies on your computer in order to remember you for return visits (e.g., a link you‚Äôve clicked on in the past will remain darkened). As nice as it is of them to RSVP on your behalf, these temporary files and cookies can cause problems with your e-mail.
‚Ä¢ If your browser‚Äôs history settings call for your history to be recorded for an especially long period of time, then the file size can become quite large. Clearing this list frees up space on your computer.
Still you have facing problem then just call our Toll free Number 1-877-848-3933 and for more info click here;

comments.text:
In the excitement of getting stuck into life in a new country and tackling all the challenges that presents, it's easy for pensions to slip down the list of things to keep track of. This is especially true if you don't plan to stay in Sweden long-term. But don't let it fall off the radar; follow The Local's guide to manage and maximize your Swedish pension, even if you don't intend to stay here permanently.Image
If you're working and paying tax in Sweden, you're probably entitled to a pension. Here's what you need to know. Photo: Simon Paulin/imagebank.sweden.se
This article is available to Members of The Local. Read more about membership here.The Swedish pension is part of the country's social insurance system, and it can seem like a confusing beast at times. The good news is that if you're living and working here, you'll almost certainly be earning towards a pension, and you'll be able to get that money even if you move elsewhere before retirement.Exactly how much money goes into your pension pot depends on many factors, including your salary, length of time working in Sweden, your company's policy, and your own personal decisions (especially if you're self-employed). Those who spend only a few years working in Sweden will earn a much smaller pension than people who work here for their whole lives, but that money could come in very useful once you retire, so it's important to know what you'll be entitled to.The easiest way to understand how the Swedish pension works is breaking it down into three parts. There are three different sources for the Swedish pension: the state, your employer, and yourself.If you've worked and paid tax in Sweden, you should be entitled to a Swedish pension. Photo: Simon Paulin/imagebank.sweden.seFirst, there's the state pension (allm√§n pension), which comes from money paid in tax, and makes up the biggest part of most people's total pensions. It falls under the remit of the Pensionsmyndigheten or the Swedish Pensions Agency, a government authority dedicated to, you guessed it, pensions.Absolutely everyone who has worked and paid tax in Sweden is entitled to this pension, and it's split into two parts: an income pension and a premium pension.The income pension (inkomstpension) makes up the bulk of this. Each year, 16 percent of your income is paid into this pension. In this context, 'income' includes wages as well as all other taxable benefits such as paid sickness or parental leave, and unemployment benefits.It's the employer who pays this, as part of the fees associated with employment, so you won't see it deducted from your salary and there's nothing that you as an employee need to do. The higher your salary, the higher the income pension will be, although once you reach the upper limit on pensionable income, your state pension won't increase any further. This upper ceiling was 41,359 kronor per month for the income year 2017, though

header: Enable text message notifications, from an email address, in the UK.
idea_text:
We have an email address dedicated to Data Protection for reporting purposes. If one has emailed in about a data breach, the organisation can be informed and act within the 72-hour window for the ICO (Information Commissioner Office).
As a majority of the organisation we only work from 9-5, Monday-Friday. The appropriate staff who are responsible for data breaches, won't check their emails on Saturday and Sunday, unless they have been notified. If there has been a data breach late on Friday evening, potentially nobody will see it until Monday morning; this only leaves 24hrs to respond being in-line with the ICO. 
So what we‚Äôre looking for is around 3 to 5 users to receive a text messaging notification from that email address, when somebody e-mails the Data Protection Mailbox.

Pre-Condition: My CC had been revoked by my provider before the expiry date due to suspected data breach at some company. Therefore, my payment card was invalid. Hence, I got a "Past Due" notice. So, I updated my CC, after fighting with where to put the details and what not...At this stage, in my head, I've made a "purchase" and "re-enabled" the account...but for the next hour, whilst I tried to find out if the update was successful the "Past Due" notice still persisted. This lead me to think that I'd not entered the CC details correctly, or what not. Or that the payment had not been taken or the update failed. So, my proposition is, and this is NOT EARTH SHATTERING, and it is in keeping with EVERY OTHER ONLINE RETAILER....How about some visibility of the payment process / update process, either by email or via the Admin portal...Let me suggest:1) We've updated you payment method to card ***8383.
2) We've verified the payment method3) We've taken payment from the card and we'll be activating your subscription soon.4) Your subscription is active.I don't care how long it takes to go through the 4 stages, but I'd love visibility...Go on, MS, send me an email :)

header: Visio: Change automation when dragging a callout from a shape folder
idea_text: In previous versions of Visio dragging a callout from a shape folder resulted in the shape being dropped on the drawing wherever the user released the mouse button and relocating was the same as any other shape. With the latest version that behavior has changed to where the callout arrow and dialog box is attached to a point determined by software automation and attempting to move it to the desired location is useless. So now all snap and glue operations must be disabled to be able to place the callout at the correct location on the drawing. This is a terrible configuration necessitating many many more keystrokes than before to be able to create the desired drawing. It is totally baffling as to why this behavior was incorporated into a system that was working nicely. If this feature has to stay to satisfy some market segment, then please provide a permanent over-ride of this automation for those of us for whom this is an overwhelming increase in drawing time.

header: Fix Visio to allow fine tuning placement of a Drawing item to move with one push of the arrow key on a keyboard.
idea_text: When making or editing a drawing in Visio 2016 pro, after dropping an item when pushing an arrow key to move the item it take move than one push of the key to get it to move. In Visio 2010 Pro this was not a problem. Also the push and hold of an arrow key in 2016 moves the item slower on the drawing than it does in 2010.  At this time we are ready to  remove 2016 and go back to 2010 on all our computers.  Our main use of drawings is floor plans for wedding and events to show where tables, stages, bars and so on will be. When placing table with chairs the need to fine tune the placement is needed to be done with arrow keys not click and drop and should be done with one push of the key.

header: Postpone the withdrawal of OWA Mobile
idea_text: Good Morning:Owa is an application widely used by our institution because it provides us with the feature of being able to open shared mailboxes which can not be seen in the Outlook for mobile application. I suggest that you postpone the withdrawal of OWA until you have an application of this facility.Ministry of Health Costa Rica

iOS App - External cloud storage API Broken
idea_text:
I have found that on the latest updates, saving from word (and excel, but haven't tested powerpoint) to a shared dropbox folder will not save. The error mentions that its due to the name being too long or have invalid characters, but this isn't the issue since saving the exact same filename to the same folder (if it wasn't a shared folder) works. ITs only when its shared with other dropbox users that you cannot save. This is across multiple iPads, tested on different users and on iOS 10.3.3 - 11.0.2.
We tried to use google drive instead to see if it was a dropbox issue, but google drive also wont work and it flags a different error. Dropbox shared folders (and google drive) work fine with all other apps (pages, safari, mail etc). Saving locally to the iPad or One drive works, but that unfortunately doesn't help. We have dont a lot of troubleshooting to narrow this down but I dont want to make this post excessively long. Please look into this so that users can use word with their company storage systems.

header: shared mailbox access - Potential security issue?
idea_text: I have noticed a potential security issue for shared mailbox access, this appears to be the case for both in-cloud and directory synced users. If the user object tied to the shared mailbox is not disabled then you are able to log onto the mailbox without the need of a license, this is possible by browsing to . I have found that someone has managed to guess the password for a shared mailbox account and used a 3rd party mail application to send out spam emails from that account. Can the idea of restricting shared mailbox access be looked at? Shared mailboxes created in-cloud do not have sign in blocked by default, so this also needs to be addressed.

idea_text:
Why are MICROSOFT DRAFTS not synchronized automatically ?
Problem : I start writing a mail - the someone calls or I am distracted or however change the app - then I go back to mail, and >pling< the email I have started before leaving the mail app is empty. This is NOT a mail app or configuration problem - on my standard Telekom Exchange email account that draft saving works fine - I can change apps back and forth, and the started email is being automatically saved when I come back to mail. Not so with the Microsoft Exchange accounts. I can only save emails there by actively cancelling and saving the mail - which is not possible when I am receiving a call. 
Why is the no professional solution fo this ?

Office 365 Admin Mobile AppApplies To: Office 365 Admin Microsoft 365 Business
Are you an Office 365 admin that‚Äôs usually on the go? Then check out the Office 365 Admin app. You can use the app to manage Office 365 from your phone or tablet. You can get the app from the Apple Store, Google Play, and from the Microsoft Store.Important: If you're having trouble using the Office 365 Admin mobile app on iOS, Android, or Windows Phone, email  for help.Download the admin mobile appOffice 365 Admin mobile app.Office 365 Mobile Admin app videoCheck out this video on how to use and navigate the app.Frequently asked questionsBelow are answers to some frequently asked questions people ask about the app.What do I need to do to be able to use the app?You must have a valid Office 365 Business subscription with admin privileges to sign in and use the app. The Office 365 Admin mobile app isn't an email client.Can I use the app with my Office 365 for home subscription?No, the app only works with Office 365 for business plans.Tip: If you're not sure which plan you have, see Office for home and Office for business plans.Will the app work if my organization has directory synchronization enabled?The app will work with reduced functionality. You'll be able to sign in and view service information, but most of the user management functions will be read-only. You won't be able to add, edit, or delete users. However, you'll be able to assign licenses to users in your organization.What languages are supported by the app?The app is available in English, Brazilian Portuguese, French, German, Japanese, Spanish, and Traditional Chinese.Why does the Messages tile on the Home screen show numbers even after I've read the new messages?The numbers are the total messages from the last week, not unread messages.How can I share the Service Incidents and Messages with the rest of my organization?If you click a specific service incident or a message, the share option will be in the top right corner. We currently support email sharing.My app is acting funny. What can I do to troubleshoot weird app behavior?You can try some common mobile app troubleshooting steps:Close and reopen the app.Uninstall and reinstall the app.How do I access beta features in the mobile app?We release beta features to the app for feedback to gauge how we can improve them before releasing worldwide. You can check out beta features by doing the following:Go to Settings.Tap the app version number 5 times to unlock More settings.Turn on beta features to test out the latest stuff we‚Äôve been working on. You'll need to restart the app for some beta features to show up.Leave feedback via the feedback tool in the app.What do I do if my question isn't answered?Email  to report an issue with the app.

header: Add the ability to register more than one technical contact in the Organisation profile.
idea_text: I am the technical contact for my domains. However, I am one of a team of 7 system administrators (and to a lesser degree, 2 technical specialists) that could be on call and raising a support case with MS. Today, for instance, we had reason to raise an emergency Sunday morning case for the complete loss of ADFS SSO functionality and I was neither on call or at work. One of our technical specialists tried to phone the support desk and was initially given difficulty in getting the emergency progressed because he was not registered as a technical contact. header: BUILD A HALF DECENT ADMIN PORTAL
idea_text:
The office 365 admin portal is without doubt the single worst website I have ever experienced in my life. In fact, I don‚Äôt think a single website designed by MS has ever worked 100% of the time for me - it's particularly amusing how some of their own sites aren't compatible with Edge but work well in other (half decent) browsers such as Firefox and Chrome!
I was wondering why Apple and Google have no difficulty creating a website that looks nice and also functions correctly, whereas Microsoft makes it seem like the most challenging thing anybody has ever done in the history of humanity?Does anybody have any insight as to exactly how MS gets away with providing such a shocking service to their clients?

header: InTune and Cisco Security Connector Integration
idea_text: Cisco has started allowing other MDMs, besides Meraki, to begin using the Cisco Security Connector.  This isn't really a MTD product, but it allows you to leverage Cisco Umbrella, and Cisco AMP, on iOS devices.  This is due to the deep security integration that Cisco can now perform on Apple devices.  I'd love to see Intune be added to the list of approved MDMs that the CSC can work with.

comments.text: We need this capability as well.  InTune needs to support the {{serial}} configuration variable for Device Configuration.  The lack of this capability will likely lead us to use a different MDM solution.

So today I rolled out the CSC iOS app to an iOS device and managed to use a device config policy with the generic XML from the umbrella portal, and if I hard coded the device serial I could get it working on one single device. The issue being that the device serial is not supported, as documented here: .
So, Microsoft, please!InTune is not supported at this time. The MDM profile needs to be pushed as a Device configuration; however, the {{serial}} configuration variable is only supported in InTune for App Config profiles at this time. Looking to use the CSC with InTune? Ask InTune to support the serial number variable in Device Config profiles!I mean I could create a single device config for each iOS device, but... no.
